definition: to swirl about/(of leaves and branches) to sway

sentences.english: On hospital bed, Her tearful eyes dance gazed at him, Therefore they are married.
sentences.chinese: 病床上，她泪眼婆娑的注视著他，于是，他们结婚了。

sentences.english: It makes even the rocks part of its dancing mirror.
sentences.chinese: 它甚至将顽石也变成为映射其婆娑姿影的一部分。

sentences.english: What constantly recurs to me is "The rain patters, the leaf quivers."[1]
sentences.chinese: 我时常能记起的是“天上淅沥下雨，树叶婆娑摇曳”。

sentences.english: After the mountain town of banyan, the number of dry rough around, whirling branches, such as shade cover.
sentences.chinese: 镇后山上有古榕，干粗数围，枝丫婆娑，浓荫如盖。

sentences.english: It's a one-window room out of which the shadows of trees were dancing.
sentences.chinese: 整个房间只有一扇窗，窗外树影婆娑。

sentences.english: It is elegant, dancing, wind, people dance chord.
sentences.chinese: 它轻盈飘逸，姿态婆娑，随风舞动，勾人心弦。

sentences.english: The wind knowingly biddings bath winter.
The trees reflected in the water are dancing.
sentences.chinese: 水中倒映的树影婆娑起舞。

definition: to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker
(of a breeze) to make (hair, leaves, clothing etc) sway gently/to ruffle
gleaming reflection of waves in sunlight
very slight sound/rustling (onom.)/to stream down (of tears)/luxuriant growth (of vegetation)
to fall and wither (like autumn leaves)/(fig.) drifting and homeless
Nichang, abbr. for the Tang Dynasty song "Raiment of Rainbows and Feathers" 霓裳羽衣曲[Ni2 chang2 yu3 yi1 qu1] or 霓裳羽衣舞[Ni2 chang2 yu3 yi1 wu3]
nichang, rainbow colored clothes worn by the Eight Immortals 八仙[Ba1 xian1]
to regret leaving/reluctant to part/(onom.) young leaves stir gently in the wind
